summary: This document is a series of 30-minute inmate observation check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 2, 2019. It details the required irregular observation schedule for inmates in locked-down status, with staff signatures for each time block. The sheets are reviewed by watch lieutenants and a captain.

keyFacts: The document is a set of standardized prison check sheets for monitoring inmates in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York.
The procedure requires staff to observe each inmate at least twice per hour, on an irregular schedule, with no more than 40 minutes between observations.
The sheets are dated July 2, 2019, which is during the period Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at MCC New York prior to his death.
Each sheet is reviewed and signed off by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, indicating a chain of custody for the observation logs.
The document is part of a series (EFTA00121439 through EFTA00121445), suggesting it is one of many routine logs from that time period.
